page.title: 10ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The land is typically undulating pasture with no large rivers, lakes or high hills. There are 5 plantations of coniferous trees, planted in recent years, making excellent cover for deer and game. At{East Bitchfield}there are remains of{lime kilns and a clay pit}which were used when the village was built.There are a number of{ancient {remains and earthworks}at{Middle {Newham}and{Roman remains}at{East {Bitchfield. Belsay village is the "New Belsay." It was built betwen 1840 and 1850. The old village was in the Bantam Field which was much nearer to the Hall. It was gradually demolished by{Sir Charles Monck}when he landscaped the Hall grounds and had completely disappeared by the early 1800's.
